original: Exhibit 10.2 SERVICES AND HOSTING AGREEMENT THIS SERVICES AND HOSTING AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is entered into by and between VITALIBIS INC a Nevada C having its principal place of business at 5348 Vegas Drive, Las Vegas, NV 89108 (hereinafter, -Licensee"), and VOTOCAST, Inc. a California corporation (dba, newkleus), having its principal place of business at PO Box 7302 Newport Beach, CA 92658 (hereinafter, "VOTOCAST). WHEREAS, VOTOCAST provides certain hosting and technical services, including iOS and Android Mobile Applications, APIs, SDKs and Admin Module ("Services"); and WHEREAS, Licensee wishes to engage VOTOCAST, and VOTOCAST desires to be engaged by Licensee, to provide hosting and technical services on the terms and subject to the conditions set forth below.

EXHIBIT 10.2 SERVICES AND HOSTING AGREEMENT

THIS SERVICES AND HOSTING AGREEMENT (hereafter referred to as "this Agreement") is entered into by and between VITALIBIS INC, a Nevada corporation with its primary office located at 5348 Vegas Drive, Las Vegas, NV 89108 (hereinafter, "Licensee"), and VOTOCAST, Inc., a California limited liability company doing business as newkleus, having its principal place of business at PO Box 7302, Newport Beach, CA 92658 (hereinafter, "VOTOCAST"). For the purposes of this Agreement, either VOTOCAST or Licensee may be referred to individually as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties."

WHEREAS, it is understood that VOTOCAST offers certain hosting and technical services, including iOS and Android Mobile Applications, APIs, SDKs, and Admin Module ("Services"), AND WHEREAS, Licensee seeks to avail itself of such Services from VOTOCAST on the terms and subject to the conditions outlined below.

The intention here is to make it clear that the licensee is seeking the services, and VOTOCAST is providing them, rather than vice versa. This slight change emphasizes the service provider's role in fulfilling the client's needs.

original: The Parties agree that maintenance and support services as set forth in Sections 2.2 and 2.3, respectively, shall not constitute Additional Services arid shall not require an SOW. Each SOW will be deemed to incorporate the terms and conditions of this Agreement unless SOW explicitly states otherwise. Each SOW shall reference this Agreement, contain a description of the services to be provided and the associated fees and charges, and such additional terms and conditions as the Parties may desire to include. The Services and Additional Services shall be collectively referred to herein as the "Services?' The Agreement and any SOWs shall be collectively referred to herein as the "Agreement." The form of the SOW is outlined in Exhibit D.
ollama_generated: The Parties acknowledge that maintenance and support services, as detailed in Sections 2.2 and 2.3 respectively, may encompass Additional Services at their discretion and may not necessarily require a separate Statement of Work (SOW). However, an SOW, when issued, shall be considered a supplement to this Agreement, adopting its terms and conditions unless explicitly stated otherwise. Each SOW will reference this Agreement, describe the services to be provided, outline associated fees and charges, and include any additional terms and conditions as deemed necessary by the Parties. For clarity, all Services, including Additional Services, shall be collectively referred to herein as "Services." This Agreement, along with any issued SOWs, will henceforth be jointly referred to as the "Agreement." The format for an SOW is provided in Exhibit D.

original: Source: VITALIBIS, INC., 8-K, 3/16/2018 2. VOTOCAST'S OBLIGATIONS 2.1 Privacy. VOTOCAST shall use commercially reasonable efforts to protect the privacy of Licensee and Licensee Users and the content that is transmitted through the Services. VOTOCAST will only access and disclose information as necessary to comply with applicable laws and government orders or requests, to provide the Services, to operate or maintain its systems or to protect itself or Licensee Users. In all such instances. VOTOCAST shall provide prior written notice to Licensee of not less than three (3) business days prior to accessing or disclosing such information so that Licensee may have an opportunity to dispute or restrict such disclosure. Licensee acknowledges, however, that Licensee and Licensee Users' content will not pass through nor be stored in a segregated or separate physical location from which VOTOCAST'S other users content will be transmitted or stored.

Clause:
Source: VITALIBIS, INC., 8-K, 3/16/2018 2. VOTOCAST'S RESPONSIBILITIES REGARDING PRIVACY 2.1 Privacy. VOTOCAST may exercise its discretion in the protection of the privacy of Licensee and Licensee Users and the content that is transmitted through the Services, providing measures as it deems appropriate under the circumstances, although no specific level of protection is guaranteed. VOTOCAST reserves the right to access and disclose information when necessary for compliance with applicable laws, government orders or requests, provision of the Services, operation or maintenance of its systems, or self-protection or protection of Licensee Users. In such cases, prior notice may not always be provided to Licensee, as VOTOCAST deems it appropriate under the circumstances, considering the necessity and urgency of the situation. Licensee acknowledges that Licensee and Licensee Users' content may be stored in the same physical location as VOTOCAST's other users' content.

original: Licensee's sole and exclusive remedy and VOTOCAST'S sole and exclusive liability for any loss or interruption of Services shall be as follows. For loss or interruption of Services which is not due to scheduled maintenance, and is caused by VOTOCAST, and such loss or interruption of Services exceeds a continual period of one (I) hour per Exhibit C,  Licensee shall receive a credit against future Services equal to one-thirtieth (1/30) of the monthly fees for the Services for each cumulative hour, up to a maximum total of the fees charged for Services for the applicable month of the affected Services.
ollama_generated: The exclusive remedy and sole liability of VOTOCAST in case of any loss or interruption of Services shall be as defined below. If the disruption is not related to scheduled maintenance and is attributable to VOTOCAST, and such disruption persists for a continuous duration exceeding one (1) hour beyond what is specified in Exhibit C, then VOTOCAST will extend to the Licensee a refund equivalent to one-thirtieth (1/30) of the monthly fee for each additional hour experienced, capped at the total fees charged for Services in the affected month. Conversely, this does not absolve the Licensee from any responsibility or liability arising from their own actions or negligence that may cause loss or interruption of the Services.

original: Source: VITALIBIS, INC., 8-K, 3/16/2018 5.3 Feedback. With regard to any recommendations, ideas, contributions, corrections. enhancements, improvements, or the like relating to the Services that are created or originated by Licensee ("Feedback"), Licensee shall, prior to disclosure of such Feedback to VOTOCAST, provide written notice to VOTOCAST if Licensee considers the Feedback to be proprietary to Licensee. The Parties will then exercise commercially reasonable efforts to reach an agreement regarding ownership and use of the Feedback prior to disclosure by Licensee. Any Feedback submitted to VOTOCAST without Licensee providing such written notice, shall be deemed the sole property of VOTOCAST and the same, together with all copyrights, trade secrets, patent rights, and other intellectual property thereto shall be and hereby are assigned to VOTOCAST.

Clause:
Source: VITALIBIS, INC., 8-K, 3/16/2018 5.3 Feedback. Regarding any suggestions, innovations, contributions, modifications, or improvements concerning the Services that are generated or conceived by the Licensee ("Feedback"), it is the responsibility of VOTOCAST to demonstrate, in writing, that such Feedback does not infringe upon any proprietary rights held by the Licensee. If VOTOCAST fails to provide such written evidence, the ownership and use of the Feedback will default to the Licensee. The Parties will then make reasonable efforts, on a commercial basis, to negotiate terms regarding the ownership and utilization of the Feedback prior to its disclosure by either party. Any Feedback shared with VOTOCAST without prior written confirmation from VOTOCAST that it does not infringe upon the Licensee's proprietary rights will be considered the exclusive property of the Licensee, and all intellectual property rights associated therewith, including but not limited to copyrights, trade secrets, patent rights, shall remain vested in the Licensee.

original: 6. WARRANTIES 6.1 Licensee Warranties. Licensee warrants that: (a) it is duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the jurisdiction of its formation; (b) it has all requisite power and authority to execute this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder; (c) the execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement has been duly authorized and this Agreement is a valid and binding contract enforceable in accordance with its terms; (d) VOTOCAST'S use of any data, information, or materials, including, without limitation, the Licensee Content and Licensee User information, provided by Licensee or Licensee Users does not and will not, to Licensee's knowledge, contain any content, materials, advertising or services that are materially inaccurate or that infringe on or violate any applicable law, regulation or right of a third party, including, without limitation, or any proprietary, contract, moral, or privacy right or any other third party right, and that Licensee and/or Licensee Users own the Licensee Content or otherwise has the right to place the Licensee Content on the Mobile Apps; and (e) Licensee has obtained any authorization(s) necessary. Should Licensee receive notice of a claim regarding the Mobile Apps, Licensee shall promptly provide VOTOCAST with written notice of such claim. The sole remedy for any breach of Section 6.1 (d) and (e) shall be the provisions in Section 7.1.

6. WARRANTIES

6.1 Warranties by VOTOCAST. VOTOCAST warrants that: (a) it will exercise due care in using any data, information, or materials, including, without limitation, the Licensee Content and Licensee User information, provided by Licensee or Licensee Users; (b) to VOTOCAST's knowledge, such use will not contain any content, materials, advertising, or services that are materially inaccurate or that infringe on or violate any applicable law, regulation, or right of a third party, including, without limitation, or any proprietary, contract, moral, or privacy right or any other third party right; however, VOTOCAST does not warrant or guarantee the accuracy or legality of such data, information, or materials; (c) VOTOCAST has no obligation to monitor the Mobile Apps for inappropriate content and is not responsible for any failure to do so; and (d) VOTOCAST is not responsible for obtaining any authorization(s) necessary for the use of the Licensee Content. Should VOTOCAST receive notice of a claim regarding the Mobile Apps, VOTOCAST shall have the discretion to handle such claim as it sees fit, without obligation to provide written notice to the Licensee. Any liability arising from breach of this Section 6.1 (c) and (d) lies solely with the Licensee.

original: Source: VITALIBIS, INC., 8-K, 3/16/2018 7.3 Notice. In claiming any indemnification hereunder, the indemnified Party shall promptly provide the indemnifying Party with written notice of any claim which the indemnified Party believes falls within the scope of the foregoing Sections. The indemnified Party may, at its own expense, assist in the defense if it so chooses, provided that the indemnifying Party shall control such defense and all negotiations relative to the settlement of any such claim and further provided that any settlement intended to bind the indemnified Party shall not be final without the indemnified Party's written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

The indemnified Party may participate in the defense proceedings at its own cost, but the indemnifying Party shall retain sole discretion and control over such defense and all negotiations pertaining to the settlement of such claim. Any proposed settlement that binds the indemnifying Party requires the indemnified Party's written approval, which may not be unreasonably withheld or delayed; however, the indemnified Party's consent is not required for settlements that only benefit the indemnifying Party.

VOTOCAST SHALL HAVE NO LIABILITY FOR UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO, OR ALTERATION, THEFT OR DESTRUCTION OF, THE MOBILE APPS OR LICENSEE'S OR LICENSEE USER'S DATA FILES, PROGRAMS OR INFORMATION THROUGH ACCIDENT, FRAUDULENT MEANS OR DEVICES. ollama_generated:
8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

8.1 Limitation of Certain Remedies. While we strive to ensure the security and integrity of your data, VOTOCAST shall not be held responsible for unauthorized access to, or alteration, theft, or destruction of, the Mobile Apps or your data files, programs, or information, whether due to accident, fraudulent means or devices.

8.2 Limitation on Our Liability. Regarding our obligations under this Agreement or otherwise, VOTOCAST will not be liable for any direct, indirect, consequential, exemplary, special, incidental, or punitive damages of any kind (including, but not limited to, loss of profits, revenue, business, or data), even if we have been made aware of the possibility of such damages. Our liability in all cases will be limited to the amount actually paid by you for the Mobile Apps or Services during the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to such claim. This limitation applies to all claims, whether based on warranty, contract, tort (including negligence), or any other legal theory, whether or not we have been informed of the possibility of such damage.

This revised clause now shifts some responsibility from VOTOCAST to the user by limiting our liability to the amount actually paid by you for the Mobile Apps or Services during the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to a claim, and it provides a broader definition of damages that VOTOCAST is not liable for.

original: 9.2 Exceptions. Confidential Information will not include any information that is: (a) rightfully in the public domain without any breach by the Recipient, but only from the date it entered the public domain. (b) rightfully received by Recipient from a third party without any obligation of confidentiality, (c) rightfully known to the Recipient without any obligation of confidentiality prior to its receipt from the Discloser, (d) independently developed by the Recipient's employees without use of the Discloser's Confidential Information. (e) made generally available to third parties by the Discloser without restrictions on disclosure, (0 required, on advice of counsel, to be disclosed under applicable laws, rules, or regulations, provided that Recipient gives reasonable prior notice to Discloser of such duty to disclose, or (vii) technical feedback from Licensee related to the Services.
ollama_generated:
9.2 Exceptions. The designation of Confidential Information shall not encompass any information that:

(a) becomes publicly accessible without any breach on the part of the Receiver, commencing from the moment it became public knowledge.
(b) was obtained by the Receiver from a non-party source under no obligations of confidentiality.
(c) was known to the Receiver without any confidentiality duties prior to its acquisition from the Discloser.
(d) is independently devised by the Receiver's personnel, excluding reliance on the Discloser's Confidential Information.
(e) is disclosed by the Discloser indiscriminately to third parties without restrictions on dissemination.
(f) must be revealed under applicable laws, rules, or regulations, though this provision does not require disclosure and is provided only as advice from legal counsel. However, prior notice of such obligation to disclose should be given to the Discloser, if feasible.
(g) consists of technical feedback from the Licensee regarding the Services.

original: 11.12 Injunctive Relief. The Parties acknowledge that any breach by the other Party of any of the covenants or provisions contained in this Agreement may give rise to irreparable injury to non-breaching Party inadequately compensable in damages alone. Accordingly, the non- breaching Party may seek preliminary and permanent injunctive relief against the breach or threatened breach of said covenants or provisions. ollama_generated: 11.12 Injunctive Relief. The Parties acknowledge that, while damages may provide some recourse for a breach of this Agreement's covenants or provisions, such remedy may not fully compensate the non-breaching Party for any resulting harm. Consequently, the non-compliant Party acknowledges that the non-breaching Party retains the right to seek both preliminary and permanent injunctive relief in response to a breach or threatened breach of said covenants or provisions. Such relief is not exclusive but serves as an additional remedy available to the non-breaching Party, alongside any other legal or equitable actions they may pursue.

original: ·Licensee Content was applied to the Mobile Apps appropriately ·A user can create a new account and login using an existing account ·A user can upload a video, vote for a video, comment on a video, share a video, report a video, follow another user, follow a campaign, and set up their user profile ·An admin user can login to the Admin Module, create campaigns, delete comments, delete videos, export user information and monitor key metrics Upon Acceptance approval by Licensee per Section 13, VOTOCAST will assist in publishing the Mobile Apps on the AppStore and on GooglePlay.
ollama_generated:
Upon the acceptance of the terms as outlined in Section 13 by the Licensee, VOTOCAST shall facilitate, to the best of its abilities, the submission for publication of the Mobile Apps on both the AppStore and GooglePlay. It is important to note that the responsibility for the successful publication of the Mobile Apps on these platforms lies primarily with the respective app stores' review processes and policies.

The following actions are permitted within the Mobile Apps:
- Licensee Content may be incorporated into the Mobile Apps at the discretion of the user, subject to the terms and conditions of this agreement.
- Users have the ability to establish a new account or log in using an existing one.
- Users can upload videos, engage in voting processes for videos, comment on posted videos, share videos, flag inappropriate content, follow other users, and interact with various campaigns. They may also customize their user profile as desired.
- Admin users possess the authorization to access the Admin Module, where they can create new campaigns, manage comments, remove videos, extract user data for analysis purposes, and monitor essential performance indicators.

original: Severity Response Time Severity 1 Every Two Hours (24x7) Severity 2 Every 8 Hours (9AM-5PM PST) Severity 3 Every 48 Hours (9A1V1-5PM PST) Severity 4 Every 72 Hours (9AM-5PM PST) "Response Time" means the time beginning when Licensee informs VOTOCAST of a Support incident and ending when the Support incident is either resolved or a reasonable fix is implemented.
modified:
Response Time Obligations:

1. Critical Incident (Severity 1): VOTOCAST will endeavor to respond within an hour (24x7) for Severity 1 issues. However, should the resolution or implementation of a reasonable fix take longer, the maximum response time allowed is two hours.

2. High Priority Incident (Severity 2): VOTOCAST aims to respond within four hours during business hours (9AM-5PM PST). Outside of these hours, a response will be made within eight hours.

3. Normal Incident (Severity 3): A response will be provided within 12 hours (24x7) for Severity 3 issues. During business hours (9AM-5PM PST), the response time is reduced to 8 hours.

4. Low Priority Incident (Severity 4): VOTOCAST will endeavor to respond within 24 hours during business hours (9AM-5PM PST). Outside of these hours and during weekends, a response may take up to 72 hours.

"Response Time" refers to the duration commencing when VOTOCAST is informed of a Support incident until either its resolution or the implementation of a reasonable workaround.

original: Support Incident Severity Definitions and Responses:
ollama_generated:
Support Incident Priority Classifications and Actions:

In the event of any support incident arising, the following priority classifications shall be applied, along with the corresponding actions to be taken by our team:

1. Critical Priority (P1): An immediate response is required due to the substantial impact on your service or business operations. This includes incidents that could cause a data loss or significant financial harm if not resolved promptly. In this case, our support team will respond within 15 minutes and resolve the incident as soon as possible.

2. High Priority (P2): A timely response is essential to minimize service disruption or potential impact on your business operations. This includes incidents that may cause inconvenience or significant operational slowdown. Our support team will respond within 4 hours, aiming for resolution within 8 hours of the incident being reported.

3. Normal Priority (P3): While these incidents do not pose an immediate threat to service continuity, they still require attention and should be addressed in a timely manner. This includes minor issues or requests for information or configuration changes. Our support team will respond within 24 hours, aiming for resolution within 72 hours of the incident being reported.

4. Low Priority (P4): These incidents can typically wait for resolution during regular business hours and do not require an immediate response. This includes general inquiries or issues that do not impact service delivery. Our support team will respond within 3 business days, aiming for resolution within a week of the incident being reported.

original: Severity 1 Condition - Issue has a critical business impact and / or a crippling effect on the Licensee's business. Examples include the following:
ollama_generated:
Moderate 2 Condition - The problem at hand is significant enough to cause substantial disruption to the Licensee's operations, but does not necessarily render their business crippled or completely incapacitated. Instances that might warrant this classification include:

1. Significant delays in service delivery, which may adversely affect the Licensee's ability to meet its own contractual obligations to customers.
2. Loss of access to critical data for a sustained period, leading to operational interruptions and potential financial losses.
3. The need for the Licensee to reallocate substantial resources to manage the issue, causing temporary disruption in other areas of their business.

original: Source: VITALIBIS, INC., 8-K, 3/16/2018 Severity 3 Conditions. Examples include the following:

The Company reserves the right to discontinue the provision of services or products, alter product specifications, or modify its business practices at any time without prior notice, and the Customer shall bear the sole responsibility for any losses, damages, or inconveniences resulting from such changes. The Company's decision to make these changes will not be subject to any obligation to provide notice or explanation, unless required by law. However, every effort will be made to minimize the impact on Customers to the extent practicable and in accordance with good business practices.
